alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 11:12PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lincoln, northeastern Logan and western Payne Counties through 1145 PM CDT... At 1111 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carney, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stillwater, Perkins, Langston, Carney, Tryon, Agra, Coyle, Mulhall, Warwick, Lake Carl Blackwell and Parkland. Those attending outdoor events should prepare for strong and gusty winds along with cloud to ground lightning. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 164 and 172. Interstate 44 between mile markers 161 and 165. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Severe weather is not expected and no warnings are anticipated at this time. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
